blak3980

Class Operator

  • java.lang.Object
    • blak3980.Operator

  • public class Operator
extends java.lang.Object
    An Operator object consists of a character and an arbitrary precedence value for a binary integer operator. These operators are + - / * % ( ). Given a pair of values this operator can be applied to these values.
    Author:
    Tyler Blakeley 090603980 Blak3980@mylaurier.ca

    • Constructor Detail

      • Operator

        public Operator(java.lang.String operator)
         throws OperatorException
        Constructs a new operator based upon the character passed in.
        Parameters:
        operator - a String whose first character(s) is an operator character
        Throws:
        OperatorException - when the string parameter does not begin with an operator

    • Method Detail

      • isOperator

        public static boolean isOperator(java.lang.String s)
        Determines whether or not the input string is an operator.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to compare against the operator pattern.
        Returns:
        true if the input string is an operator, false otherwise.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Operator operator)
        Parameters:
        operator - The operator to compare to this operator object.
        Returns:
        true if operator is not null and if the strings that make up the operators' symbols are the same, false otherwise.

      • perform

        public Poly perform(Poly x,
           Poly y)
             throws OperatorException

        Applies a binary operator to two Poly parameters.

        (A similar function could be written for any appropriate class.)

        Parameters:
        x - the first Poly for the binary operator
        y - the second Poly for the binary operator
        Returns:
        the result of applying the operator to x and y
        Throws:
        OperatorException

      • precedes

        public boolean precedes(Operator operator)
        Returns whether the current operator precedes another operator.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to compare precedence against.
        Returns:
        true if the current operator precedes the second operator, false otherwise.
